snippet.title: Creamy Crab Appetizer
snippet.description: This hot Creamy Crab Appetizer is beautifully garnished with thinly chopped green onions. Ready in less than 30 minutes, it will add a flourish to your entertaining specialties.

snippet.title: Welsh Rarebit Crab Dip
snippet.description: Welsh Rarebit Crab Dip is extremely rich and will be a favorite with all those seafood lovers in your family. Serve with crisp chips or crackers or spread on toasted French bread slices for your next party.

snippet.title: Crab Curry Dip
snippet.description: This low fat Crab Curry Dip is delicious. The curry flavoring adds zest to this recipe. A sure crowd pleaser.

snippet.title: Creamed Chipped Beef Ranch Dip
snippet.description: Creamed Chipped Beef Ranch Dip will be a hit at your next party. Serve hot with bread pieces for dipping.

snippet.title: Creamy Crab Canapés
snippet.description: These Creamy Crab Canapés make a festive, colorful and delicious appetizer.

snippet.title: Bacon, Tomato and Cheese Dip
snippet.description: Served with fresh bread and/or crackers for dipping, this Bacon, Tomato and Cheese Dip is sure to be a hit at your next gathering!

snippet.title: Mexican-Style Surimi
snippet.description: This Mexican-Style Surimi is an economical and tasty version of a crab dip that will be great to serve at your next party or gathering.

snippet.title: Deviled Eggs
snippet.description: These festive Deviled Eggs get a tasty flavor boost from salsa and chopped cilantro. This easy-to-make recipe creates a very attractive snack or appetizer.

snippet.title: Baked Ravioli Bites
snippet.description: Baked Ravioli Bites are decorated with artful toppings and are irresistible additions to a night of entertaining.

snippet.title: Ham Croquettes
snippet.description: These crispy Ham Croquettes are little logs of seasoned minced ham. They are Cuba’s national appetizers but their exquisite flavors are sure to please everyone! Croquettes are easy to prepare, but shaping them does require some time. Fortunately, they can be shaped a day ahead, covered, and refrigerated before frying. For the best flavor, use a good-quality smoked or baked ham and ask your butcher to grind it for you.
